javadoc: ChangeMapFile tracks which buffers within a LocalBufferFile have been modified between an older and newer version. The older file is also refered to as the target file.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Construct a map file for output.  If the file exists it will be updated,
 otherwise a new file will be created.

throws.comment: if file already exists or an IO error occurs

methods.name: <init>

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this change map corresponds to the specified target file.
@param targetFile
methods.name: isValidFor
methods.comment: Returns true if this change map corresponds to the specified target file.

methods.javadoc:
Abort the creation/update of this file.
 This method should be invoked in place of close on a failure condition.
 An attempt is made to restore the version file to its initial state
 or remove it if it was new.
methods.name: abort
methods.comment:
Abort the creation/update of this file.
 This method should be invoked in place of close on a failure condition.
 An attempt is made to restore the version file to its initial state
 or remove it if it was new.

methods.name: bufferChanged
getModData
methods.comment: Returns data suitable for use by the ChangeMap class.

name: ChangeMapFile
comment:
ChangeMapFile tracks which buffers within a LocalBufferFile 
 have been modified between an older and newer version.  The older
 file is also refered to as the target file.
